frame.name: Assessing
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Assessor</fen> examines a <fen>Phenomenon</fen> to figure out its <fen>Value</fen> according to some <fen>Feature</fen> of the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>. This <fen>Value</fen> is a factor in determining the acceptability of the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>. In some cases, a <fen>Method</fen> (implicitly involving an <fen>Assessor</fen>) is used to determine the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>'s <fen>Value</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Phenomenon">Each company</fex> is then <t>evaluated</t> <fex name="Feature">for their earning potential</fex>. <fex name="Assessor">CNI</fex> </ex> <ex><fex name="Evidence">From the evidence of the pilot studies</fex> <fex name="Phenomenon">the risk of damage to the test subjects</fex> was <t>rated</t> <fex name="Value">too high to continue</fex>. <fex name="Assessor">CNI</fex></ex> <ex><fex name="Assessor">He</fex> <t>weighed</t> <fex name="Phenomenon">his options</fex> <fex name="Manner">carefully</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Assessor
FE.definition: <def-root>The sentient entity that evaluates the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Phenomenon
FE.definition: <def-root>The entity whose <fen>Value</fen> according to a <fen>Feature</fen> is being measured.</def-root>

FE.name: Value
FE.definition: <def-root>The value (according to some scale) that the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is deemed to have. The <fen>Value</fen> is taken to indicate the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>'s acceptability.</def-root>

FE.name: Feature
FE.definition:
<def-root>The type of property or feature that the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is being judged on.
<ex>You will also be <t>graded</t> <fex name="fea">on your speed of response</fex> . </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Evidence
FE.definition: <def-root>Some fact perceived by the <fen>Assessor</fen> which leads to their evaluation of the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition:
<def-root>Any secondary effect of the action or characterization of the <fen>Assessor</fen> which saliently affects the character of the assessment.
<ex>He <fex name="Manner">quietly</fex> <t>graded</t> the papers.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Method
FE.definition:
<def-root>An event or procedure that allows the <fen>Assessor</fen> to evaluate the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.
<ex><fex name="met">The study</fex> <t>evaluated</t> the risk of a major quake.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>The means by which assessment occurs</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>The time at which the <fen>Assessor</fen> makes the assessment.
<ex>The committee <t>rated</t> Smithers " most loyal servant " <fex name="tim">about a week ago</fex> .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Standard
FE.definition:
<def-root>An entity that the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is compared to in the assessment.
<ex>Smiter <t>weighed</t> his chances in the snow <fex name="sta">against the danger posed by the troop of sycophants hurtling towards him</fex>. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>The goal that the <fen>Assessor</fen> hopes to accomplish by assessing the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>The location where the assessing takes place.
<ex>They 'll <t>evaluate</t> you <fex name="pla">in that room over there</fex> , and then you 're free to go .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Medium
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used by the <fen>Assessor</fen> to make the assessment.
<ex><fex name="Medium">This chapter</fex> <t>evaluates</t> the far-left's contribution to the environmentalism debate since the '70's .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Co_participant
FE.definition:
<def-root>A person who participates along with the <fen>Assessor</fen> in the assessing event.
<ex>In order to find the best suited, targeted form of activity, the prisoner?s work and functioning capability is <t>assessed</t> together <fex name="cop">with him/her</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Frequency
FE.definition:
<def-root>This frame element is defined as the number of times assessing occurs per some unit of time.
<ex>Brown 's chapter on geodemographics discusses an application field where primary data collected for operational purposes are <fex name="Fre">typically</fex> <t>evaluated</t> in relation to secondary data derived from sources such as the Census of Population .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Beneficiary
FE.definition: <def-root>This extrathematic FE applies to participants that derive a benefit from the occurrence of the event specified by the target predicate. Further, the target predicate should involve some sort of Agent that intends that the benefit go to the Beneficiary.</def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE describes a participant of the state of affairs introduced by the target as being in some state during the action. The depicted state does not necessarily or usually facilitate or cause the state of affairs reported by the target. </def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>This frame element selects some gradable attribute and modifies the expected value for it.</def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition: <def-root>The state of the world at a partiicular time and place. </def-root>

FE.name: Result
FE.definition: <def-root>The result of the assessing. </def-root>

FE.name: Duration
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE denotes the length of time during which a continuous event occurs.</def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>The Explanation denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: assess.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to evaluate or judge some quality of an object or situation "How would you assess her performance on the job?"

lexUnit.name: rate.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to evaluate something on a scale depending on some quality, esp. when the number of outcomes is limited "Travelers rated Japan Air Lines "Excellent" with regard to in-flight service."

lexUnit.name: evaluate.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to judge something against a standard, as to its merit or suitability

lexUnit.name: grade.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to decide on the basis of some quality where to place something along an established scale "Geologists grade rocks according to their hardness."

lexUnit.name: assessment.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the action of assessing; evaluating, judging

lexUnit.name: evaluation.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the act of judging the value or worth of something

lexUnit.name: weigh.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to determine the weight of something

lexUnit.name: judge.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: decide the value or significance of some feature

lexUnit.name: value.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: declare the value or significance of some feature

lexUnit.name: rank.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: rate with respect to other members of a category.

lexUnit.name: appraise.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: assess the value, quality, or performance of.

lexUnit.name: appraisal.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an assessment of someone or something, especially the performance of an employee.

lexUnit.name: reappraisal.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an examination of the quality of for a second time.
